accessibility.text: A good proxy for prices is the CPI
If I buy lunch every day and the price is $15/lunch, then I need to have 7x15=$105 in cash or check
What determines how much income is needed for transactions?
How much money is needed to purchase goods and services  depends on

A good proxy for quantities is real GDP
To calculate the amount of liquid balances (cash and deposits) needed for the entire U.S. economy, we need to know:
The prices of all goods and services purchased and
The total number of units purchased
